Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Implement complete MIDI guitar pedal MCP server

- Add comprehensive data models for pedals, CC parameters, and MIDI commands
- Implement JSON-based persistence layer with Gson
- Create full MCP server with 5 tools for pedal management
- Add Meris LVX delay pedal with complete 19-parameter CC table
- Implement natural language sound request interpretation
- Add MIDI command generation with byte-level output
- Include run script and updated documentation
- Support for adding custom pedals and generating MIDI CC commands

Features:
- Natural language processing for guitar effects terminology
- Persistent pedal knowledge storage
- Real-time MIDI command generation
- Extensible architecture for multiple pedal models

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Refactor architecture: AI assistant handles NLP, MCP focuses on execution

- Moved natural language processing responsibility to AI assistant
- MCP server now focuses solely on MIDI command execution and pedal management
- Added comprehensive MIDI execution layer with mock/hardware implementations
- Updated MCP tools: execute_midi_command, execute_midi_commands, get_midi_status
- Removed redundant SoundRequestInterpreter and natural language tools
- Cleaned up tests: removed trivial data verification tests, kept functional behavior tests
- Added end-to-end tests demonstrating AI assistant â†’ MCP server â†’ hardware flow
- Updated documentation to reflect clean separation of concerns

Architecture improvements:
- Better separation of concerns between AI intelligence and MIDI execution
- More testable with mock MIDI executor and command tracking
- Cleaner MCP interface focused on command execution
- Reduced from 39 to 25 focused tests covering real functionality

EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add Mercury X reverb pedal support with comprehensive MIDI CC table

- Add MerisMercuryXLoader with complete 70+ parameter MIDI CC mappings
- Implement all 8 reverb structures (Ultraplate, Cathedra, Spring, 78 Room/Plate/Hall, Prism, Gravity)
- Include processing elements: Dynamics, Preamp, Filter, Pitch, Modulation
- Add predelay system with full routing capabilities
- Support expression control, gate controls, Hold Modifier, and tuner
- Update App.kt to load both LVX and Mercury X pedals
- Update README with Mercury X documentation and usage examples
- All 25 tests pass successfully

Mercury X Features:
- Modular reverb system with 8 unique reverb structures
- Comprehensive predelay with time, feedback, cross feedback, modulation
- Flexible signal routing (Pre+Dry, Pre, Feedback, Pre Tank, Post)
- Advanced processing elements with location control
- Expression pedal support with 6 assignable mappings
- Gate controls for gated reverb effects
- Hold Modifier for expressive control
- Built-in tuner and MIDI clock synchronization

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Configure pedals on separate MIDI channels to avoid conflicts

- Update Meris LVX to use MIDI channel 2  
- Keep Meris Mercury X on MIDI channel 1
- Update README to document MIDI channel assignments
- All 25 tests pass successfully

MIDI Channel Assignment:
- Mercury X Reverb: Channel 1
- LVX Delay: Channel 2

This allows both pedals to be used simultaneously without MIDI conflicts.

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
